SEARCH
Package jromp

Class JROMP

java.lang.Object
jromp.JROMP
public class JROMP extends Object
The main class for the parallel runtime.

  • Method Details

    • allThreads

      public static JROMP allThreads()
      Configures the parallel runtime with the default number of threads.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • withThreads

      public static JROMP withThreads(int threads)
      Configures the parallel runtime with the specified number of threads.
      Parameters:
      threads - The number of threads to use.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • withThreads

      public static JROMP withThreads(int threads, int threadsPerTeam)
      Configures the parallel runtime with the specified number of threads and threads per team.
      Parameters:
      threads - The number of threads to use.
      threadsPerTeam - The number of threads per team.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • registerVariables

      public JROMP registerVariables(Variable<?>... vars)
      Register the given variables into the current parallel context.
      Parameters:
      vars - The variables to register.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • join

      public void join()
      Wait for all threads to finish and perform the necessary operations.

    • parallel

      public JROMP parallel(Task task)
      Executes a task in a parallel block, using the current variables.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to run.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • parallel

      public JROMP parallel(boolean shouldParallelize, Task task)
      Executes a task in a parallel block, using the current variables, if the condition is met. Otherwise, the task is executed by one of the threads.
      Parameters:
      shouldParallelize - The condition to check if the task should be executed in parallel.
      task - The task to run.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • parallelFor

      public JROMP parallelFor(int start, int end, boolean nowait, boolean shouldParallelize, ForTask task)
      Executes a for loop in parallel with the given start and end indices, using a task implementation if the condition is met. Otherwise, the task is executed by one of the threads.
      Parameters:
      start - The start index of the for loop.
      end - The end index of the for loop.
      nowait - Whether to wait for the threads to finish.
      shouldParallelize - The condition to check if the task should be executed in parallel.
      task - The task to be executed in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • parallelFor

      public JROMP parallelFor(int start, int end, boolean nowait, ForTask task)
      Executes a for loop in parallel with the given start and end indices, using a task implementation.
      Parameters:
      start - The start index of the for loop.
      end - The end index of the for loop.
      nowait - Whether to wait for the threads to finish.
      task - The task to be executed in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • parallelFor

      public JROMP parallelFor(int start, int end, ForTask task)
      Executes a for loop in parallel with the given start and end indices, using a task implementation.
      Parameters:
      start - The start index of the for loop.
      end - The end index of the for loop.
      task - The task to be executed in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • sections

      public JROMP sections(boolean nowait, boolean shouldParallelize, Task... tasks)
      Executes the given tasks in separate sections if the condition is met. Otherwise, the tasks are executed by one of the threads.
      Parameters:
      nowait - Whether to wait for the threads to finish.
      shouldParallelize - The condition to check if the task should be executed in parallel.
      tasks - The tasks to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • sections

      public JROMP sections(boolean nowait, Task... tasks)
      Executes the given tasks in separate sections.
      Parameters:
      nowait - Whether to wait for the threads to finish.
      tasks - The tasks to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • sections

      public JROMP sections(Task... tasks)
      Executes the given tasks in separate sections, waiting for the threads to finish.
      Parameters:
      tasks - The tasks to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • sections

      public JROMP sections(boolean nowait, List<Task> tasks)
      Executes the given tasks in separate sections.
      Parameters:
      nowait - Whether to wait for the threads to finish.
      tasks - The tasks to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • sections

      public JROMP sections(List<Task> tasks)
      Executes the given tasks in separate sections.
      Parameters:
      tasks - The tasks to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • single

      public JROMP single(boolean nowait, Task task)
      Submits a block that can only be executed by a single thread.
      Parameters:
      nowait - Whether to wait for the threads to finish.
      task - The task to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • single

      public JROMP single(Task task)
      Submits a block that can only be executed by a single thread.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • masked

      public JROMP masked(int filter, Task task)
      Executes the given task in the specified thread.
      Parameters:
      filter - The thread to run the task in.
      task - The task to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • masked

      public JROMP masked(Task task)
      Executes the given task in the master thread.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to run in parallel.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • barrier

      public JROMP barrier()
      Blocks the execution of the threads until all threads reach the barrier.
      Returns:
      The parallel runtime.

    • isMaster

      public static boolean isMaster(int id)
      Check if the thread is the master thread.
      Parameters:
      id - The thread ID.
      Returns:
      true if the thread is the master thread, false otherwise.

    • getWTime

      public static double getWTime()
      Get the elapsed wall clock time.
      Returns:
      The elapsed wall clock time.

    • getThreadNum

      public static int getThreadNum()
      Get the current thread number.
      Returns:
      The thread number.

    • getThreadTeam

      public static ThreadTeam getThreadTeam()
      Get the team of the current thread.
      Returns:
      The team of the current thread or null if the thread is not a JROMP thread.

    • getNumThreads

      public static int getNumThreads()
      Get the number of threads used in the current parallel block. If not in a parallel context, or parallelism is disabled, the number of threads is 1.
      Returns:
      The number of threads.

    • getNumThreadsPerTeam

      public static int getNumThreadsPerTeam()
      Get the number of threads per team used in the current parallel block. If not in a parallel context, the number of threads per team is 1.
      Returns:
      The number of threads per team.
